meanings.definition: Make (a person or animal) immune to infection by vaccination.
meanings.sent1: The doctor immunised the child against measles with a shot.
meanings.sent2: The nurse immunised the puppy to protect it from getting sick.
meanings.sent3: The superhero immunised the city against the evil virus with his special powers.
meanings.sent4: The shield of protection immunised the computer from harmful viruses.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion immunised the kingdom from any harm.

meanings.definition: Provide a person or animal with immunity against a particular disease.
meanings.sent1: The clinic immunised the community against the flu outbreak.
meanings.sent2: The vet immunised the cat to keep it healthy.
meanings.sent3: The wizard immunised the dragon against fire attacks.
meanings.sent4: The strong walls immunised the castle from enemy invasions.
meanings.sent5: The golden amulet immunised the wearer from any curses.
